properties.name: Penn Visual Object Learning Test Delayed Memory
properties.alias: sVOLTd, Short VOLT delay, VOLTd, sVOLTd
properties.definition_text:
The delayed memory portion of the sVOLT tasj. 

In the first part of this test, participants were shown 10 three-dimensional Euclidean shapes that they were asked to identify for immediate recall (sVOLT . Now, during the delayed recall (sVOLTd , participants are shown a series, one at a time, of 20 three-dimensional Euclidean shapes - the 10 shapes they were asked to memorize during the SVOLT mixed with 10 novel shapes. The participantâs task is to decide whether he/she has seen the shape before by clicking with the mouse on one of four buttons: âDEFINITELY YESâ, âPROBABLY YESâ, "PROBABLY NO" and "DEFINITELY NO". (NOTE: The original sVOLT had only two response choices: âYES I have seen the shapeâ and âNO I have not seen the shape.â . Participants have 20 seconds to select a response before the test moves on to the next trial. There are two forms of the sVOLTd: the sVOLTd-A and sVOLTd-B.
